context: Does the Webb actually capture color or is it added when the data for the images is processed?

replies.context: The color is a function of the wavelengths of light captured, e.g., far-, mid-, and near-infrared.

I know what causes color.  The question was is the data massaged to generate color (as NASA has done in the past) or is it interpreted color during the processing step(s)?  Do they have separate RGB optical sensors or just one BW?

All colors of the visible (as well as "invisible") spectrum can be captured. They can be toned by filters to illuminate features that would otherwise be obscured by the intensity of other wavelengths. I have a doctorate in physics, but optics is not my specialty.
Not mine either by the looks of my ex wife.

The Webb can't see yellow, green, blue, violet colors.
It's outside the wavelengths it can detect.
Apparently it sees from the near-UV (600 nm) into the mid-IR (28.7 μm), those bookends are outside the visible range.

With the levels of technology available today, why would the first question be whether the color of the image was manipulated in processing? Is someone just looking for something to criticize? Just askin'.
The spectrum that Webb scans is shifted to the visual spectrum.  It is processing in a colors not visible to the human eye.
Thank you,Mr. WIKI.

And since we don't SEE far, mid or near infrared,
the images use mainly "false" coloring (choosing colors to represent different parts of the infrared spectrum the instruments see).

But since the Near-Infrared Camera covers the wavelength rage 0.6 to 5 microns,
it actually overlaps with orange and red light that we can see (0.6 to 0.8 microns is orange to red)

Not "false coloring." These are not photographs, but rather the product of the light images measured spectroscopically, and electronically "imprinted" for you to see. To highlight or expose components in these electronic pictures, wavelengths and frequencies are modulated by computer to bring out these components in order that they may be seen more clearly by the human eye. The computer "sees" everything captured by the telescope and all the data (light wavelengths, frequencies, speed, and location) are stored for analyses,

The Webb has four scientific instruments - one of them is just a simple CCD camera, but looking at wavelengths from 0.6 to 5 microns - Near-Infrared Camera (NIRCam).  This overlaps actual visible light (orange and red), but to give an image of the full spectrum it sees, they use "false colors".

So in the "photograph", red could start at 0.6 microns, and 5 microns would be violet.  The "full color" photograph would show the intensities at all the wavelengths the camera sees - but it wouldn't be what a human would see looking in a regular telescope.

The Webb does have the ability to do spectrographs, or time-series data - they have 17 different "modes" of data they can capture from the 4 instruments.

The Webb has some interesting "microshutters" for the near-infrared spectrograph (NIRSPEC)- so it can obtain 100 simultaneous spectrographs while looking at many objects.

I agree, it's a highly computerized scientific instrument, not just a "telescope".
For 6 billion it better.
It captures color. It's not like space photos from the 80s and early 90s where everything the public gets is little more than an artists rendering of fuzzy black and white smears.
Webb captures wavelength, but it's infrared below what we can see.  Since humans can't see infrared, the JWST team translates the IR wavelengths JWST captures into colors we can see and understand.

The closest star (besides the sun) to earth is Proxima Centauri - 4.1 light years away. Traveling as fast as any astronaut has ever traveled (25,000 mph, Apollo 10), starting on the day you were born and hurtling through space at that speed towards Proxima Centauri ... for the rest of your life...this *closest star* would seem no closer on the day you died than it did on the day you were born. (you'd only cover about 1/1000th of the distance in an entire lifetime. James Webb Space Telescope images revealed today - with the most distant objects 13 billion light years away ... it would take 300 billion *lifetimes* traveling at 25,000 miles per hour to reach those galaxies (hint - they'd be gone well before you ever got there).

replies.context: How are they in conflict?  Big Bang cosmology says nothing about origins.  You can't see back that far to make any definitive assertion about the origins of the universe.

I'm of the opinion that God created our universe and probably many others.  How he created them is up for debate, Big Bang or something else, but it really doesn't matter.  We cannot comprehend God the same way an ant cannot comprehend us.

They aren't in conflict and there was NO BEFORE the big bang. Time is something that is relative to each individual object in space and determined by it's velocity through space. Time is not the same for everything and is a property of space and matter.

"Time is something that is relative to each individual object in space and determined by it's velocity through space."

No, the measurement of time is relative.

Put someone in a black cave with no light and no outside influence (and no watch!).  The measurement of time will cease to exist, but existing nonetheless will establish that there is, in fact, time.

No the actual passage of time is relative to every object  and is dependent on that object’s velocity and can be shown with the Lorentz transformations. Beyond that special and general relativity provide the most accurate picture of our cosmos (on all but the tiniest scales) where space and time are combined into a single 4 dimensional manifold called spacetime. A pretty amazing intro is laid out in Einstein’s 1905 paper “On the electrodynamics of moving bodies” specifically part 1 section 2.

I don't know of anyone who suggests that the Big Bang happened spontaneously without any cause whatsoever.  The consensus is that it did happen and did have a cause, whether that cause be God or something else.  Either way, it strongly suggests alternate dimensions exist outside of this universe.

There is no scientific explanation for the existence of God. The supernatural is outside the realm of science, which deals strictly with the natural world. God is a matter of faith.

context:
Astronomers estimate that there are at least 100 to 200 billion stars in the Milky Way.

An average galaxy is estimated to have 100 million stars in it.

The observable Universe is estimated to have at least 10 trillion galaxies in it.

The total stars in the observable Universe is estimated to be 1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 stars or "1" with 24 zeros following after it also known as 1 septillion in the number system in the United States.

Each star may have 9 planets orbiting around that star. That would make it 9 * 10^24 planets in the observable Universe.

It is estimated that the Universe has at least 5,300,000,000,000 or 5.3 trillion planets that might have life on it.

Some scientists speculate that there might be 36 intelligent alien civilization in the Milky Way (our own galaxy.)

If the observable Universe has 10 trillion galaxy in it and there are 36 intelligent life per galaxy, then the Universe has 360 trillion intelligent life in the Universe.

We are not Alone.

Because of the vast distant between each galaxies, space travel between galaxies may not be possible if a limiting factor for traversing the Universe is the speed of light.

It may even be difficult to traverse in our Milky Way.

The nearest star to our Sun is about 4.35 light years away meaning that it takes 4.35 years traveling at the speed of light to reach those stars.

Communication to that star would take 4.35 years to receive a message from Earth.

It is speculated that civilizations in the Universe comes and goes. A civilization existing billions of years ago may no longer exist nowadays.

Evidence of civilizations that have come and gone should still be available to us at some point.  I just don't think we are quite there from a scientific perspective, to make that claim.  Would I bet the house to say we are the only life out there?  Heck no.  That would be a bad bet.

Speaking of Newton...Stephen Snobelen, a renowned Newton scholar at the University of King's College, has pointed out, Newton's way of understanding God's interaction with nature did not at all inhibit his scientific work. Instead, his understanding of God as (1) the source and sustainer of mathematically describable order in the universe and (2) the intelligent designer of living systems and the solar system actually inspired his scientific endeavor. The Principia was a theologically inspired mathematical treatise in which Newton sought to bring glory to God by discovering, as its title indicates, the "mathematical principles" that governed the universe. Similarly, Newton’s conviction in the intelligibility of nature led him to investigate how natural systems work, so that he could appreciate and bear witness to their ingenious design. For Newton, postulating divine action as part of his natural philosophy was anything but a science stopper. The Return of the God Hypothesis: Three Scientific Discoveries that Reveal the Mind Behind the Universe, p. 430. Stephen C. Meyer, Harper Collins, 2021

context: We don’t even scratch the surface when it comes to solving all of the universe’s riddles. As a planet with intelligent life, or at least that’s what we like to call ourselves, you gotta last at least long enough to solve enough of those riddles for life to have any real meaning and that means, not us. You got the Periodic Table which introduces us to the gang of 118 and tells us a little bit about their personalities but there’s nothing anywhere in that table that’s going to get us to to Alpha Centauri, the closest solar system to ours, just over 4 light years away, in any of our lifetimes. We can send unmanned, interplanetary rocket drones to what we think is a Blue Planet in the Alpha Centauri gravitational bound system as a way to let them know that we heard the phone ringing, but it won’t arrive there for at least a hundred thousand years. We can show them how to get here but you know what? Let’s not even bother. For some reason we never named our solar system, probably do to our low self image.

They and China have since had probes circle the Moon and put robot landers on it as well. Why wouldn't have they revealed America as liars by now?

Scientists and colleges around the world can fire lasers at reflector stations put there by our moon landings to measure the distance from Earth to there. Why haven't they revealed the "lie"?

The Soviet space flight fakery was called out in the mid-60’s by Lloyd Mallon (Popular Mechanics, 1966), with in depth research and irrefutable evidence. Little was made of this since we were in a concocted “space race”. Gagarin never ‘orbited’ or re-entered the atmosphere at hypersonic in that comical Vostok cannonball- and “bailed out” to safety with a parachute.. 

Prior to all of these alleged ‘space flight’ stunts, it was confirmed that hypersonic re-entry is impossible because of rapid vaporization. NO material could, can or ever will be able to ‘survive’ the heat, which was documented- by NASA- to be 100,000 deg. F.

Perhaps now you can understand that NASA and the CCP are/were ONE organization formed to con the masses. The Chinese are also part of the global con, even though their fakery is deplorable.

BTW the moon does reflect energy. This was also well known prior to Apollo. And to think that anyone has equipment with the capability to “hit” a tiny reflector on the  moon, is asinine.
There is no air in space, therefore no friction, so you don't need to waste a lot of weight on unnecessarily thick structures.

And as we all know, scopes do not give distances, therefore these are all assumed. The speed of light does not have anything to do with these images being verified as ‘real’. The sole purpose of NASA’s existence is mass hypnosis by defrauding the public (esp. institutions) with ‘astro-evolution’.

context: WOW!!!!! WHAT AN AWESOME UNIVERSE GOD CREATED

There are those who have long professed the belief that science and religion are at war with each other. Albert Einstein disagreed. “The more I study science, the more I believe in God,” he is reported to have said. Science has as its goal discovering the laws which govern the universe; religion reminds us of the identity of the lawgiver. Laws do not come into being on their own. And laws of the universe are the products of a divine intellect.
Joseph H. Taylor, Jr., Nobel Prize winner in Physics for the discovery of the first known binary pulsar, and for his work which supported the Big Bang theory of the creation of the universe, said, “A scientific discovery is also a religious discovery. There is no conflict between science and religion. Our knowledge of God is made larger with every discovery we make about the world.”

The Soviet space flight fakery was called out in the mid-60’s by Lloyd Mallon (Popular Mechanics, 1966), with in depth research and irrefutable evidence. Little was made of this since we were in a concocted “space race”. Gagarin never ‘orbited’ or re-entered the atmosphere at hypersonic in that comical Vostok cannonball- and “bailed out” to safety with a parachute.. 

Prior to all of these alleged ‘space flight’ stunts, it was confirmed that hypersonic re-entry is impossible because of rapid vaporization. NO material could, can or ever will be able to ‘survive’ the heat, which was documented- by NASA- to be 100,000 deg. F.

Perhaps now you can understand that NASA and the CCP are/were ONE organization formed to con the masses. The Chinese are also part of the global con, even though their fakery is deplorable.

BTW the moon does reflect energy. This was also well known prior to Apollo. And to think that anyone has equipment with the capability to “hit” a tiny reflector on the  moon, is asinine.
There is no air in space, therefore no friction, so you don't need to waste a lot of weight on unnecessarily thick structures.

And as we all know, scopes do not give distances, therefore these are all assumed. The speed of light does not have anything to do with these images being verified as ‘real’. The sole purpose of NASA’s existence is mass hypnosis by defrauding the public (esp. institutions) with ‘astro-evolution’.

Stephen Snobelen, a renowned Newton scholar at the University of King's College, has pointed out, Newton's way of understanding God's interaction with nature did not at all inhibit his scientific work. Instead, his understanding of God as (1) the source and sustainer of mathematically describable order in the universe and (2) the intelligent designer of living systems and the solar system actually inspired his scientific endeavor. The Principia was a theologically inspired mathematical treatise in which Newton sought to bring glory to God by discovering, as its title indicates, the "mathematical principles" that governed the universe. Similarly, Newton’s conviction in the intelligibility of nature led him to investigate how natural systems work, so that he could appreciate and bear witness to their ingenious design. For Newton, postulating divine action as part of his natural philosophy was anything but a science stopper. The Return of the God Hypothesis: Three Scientific Discoveries that Reveal the Mind Behind the Universe, p. 430. Stephen C. Meyer, Harper Collins, 2021

We don’t even scratch the surface when it comes to solving all of the universe’s riddles. As a planet with intelligent life, or at least that’s what we like to call ourselves, you gotta last at least long enough to solve enough of those riddles for life to have any real meaning and that means, not us. You got the Periodic Table which introduces us to the gang of 118 and tells us a little bit about their personalities but there’s nothing anywhere in that table that’s going to get us to to Alpha Centauri, the closest solar system to ours, just over 4 light years away, in any of our lifetimes. We can send unmanned, interplanetary rocket drones to what we think is a Blue Planet in the Alpha Centauri gravitational bound system as a way to let them know that we heard the phone ringing, but it won’t arrive there for at least a hundred thousand years. We can show them how to get here but you know what? Let’s not even bother. For some reason we never named our solar system, probably do to our low self image.
